newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline ends firm on raft of bullish factors.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline ends firm on raft of bullish factors.

text.p: NWE gasoline was firmer on Friday as NYMEX unleaded futures maintained most of their recent gains, cargo-sized parcels remained scarce and run cuts supportive, traders said.
Eurograde barges traded earlier on at $212 fob Rotterdam and then at $212.25 fob Rotterdam later on.
Swaps were talked around $209/$211 for June paper and were done at $209.25, $209.50 and $209.75.
Cargoes remained relatively high with premium unleaded assessed in the $218/$222 range.

Traders said the market was well supported by a raft of bullish factors such as healthy U.S. demand, stockpiling of cargoes by British players ahead of the post-election mini budget, refinery run cuts and an IOC tender.
Traders said U.S. demand appeared to be taking material out of Europe at a steady pace. Gasoline players see 150-200,000 tonnes heading for the United States between May 15 and June 1.
The Memorial Day holiday on Monday in the United States traditionally marks tbe summer gasoline season's shift into top gear.

Meanwhile, expectations of tax hikes on auto fuel in the post-election mini budget were leading to stockpiling by some British players hoping to sell pre-budget taxed material at post-budget tax prices.
News that State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) was to tender for leaded and unleaded gasoline was also seen as supportive to the market.

The company has issued a first tender, which closes May 28, to buy 25,000 tonnes of 87 octane for June 10-14 delivery. A second tender is for 16 kilolitres of unleaded gasoline for delivery in July and 32 kilolitres for delivery each in August, September and October.
